properties.Title: Special Weather Statement In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Heavy snow today. What: Heavy snow. Total accumulations of 10 to 15 cm are expected. Where: Fort Albany and Moosonee. When: This morning through midnight. Discussion: Periods of heavy snow are expected today, with rapid snowfall accumulation and associated poor visibility. Ice pellets and some freezing rain are also possible this afternoon near or southeast of Moosonee. Snow will weaken this evening but continue until near midnight with a couple of additional centimetres possible. ### Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to ONstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #ONStorm.
Expires: 2021-03-12T08:21:12-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2021-03-11T16:22:12-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.1025874078.2021
Area: Fort Albany, Moosonee
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Squall Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Squalls with wind gusts up to 45 knots are occurring in the next few hours. ### Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. For more information monitor Canadian Coast Guard radio or Weatheradio stations.

properties.Title: Special Air Quality Statement In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Elevated pollution levels are expected or occurring. DUST ADVISORY IN EFFECT FOR VERNON (March 10, 2021 - Vernon) The Ministry of Environment and Climate Change Strategy in collaboration with the Interior Health has continued a Dust Advisory for Vernon because of high concentrations of coarse particulate matter that are expected to persist until there is precipitation, dust suppression or a change in traffic patterns. Levels tend to be highest around busy roads and industrial operations. This advisory is in effect until further notice. Exposure is particularly a concern for individuals with chronic conditions such as asthma, COPD, heart disease, and diabetes, respiratory infections such as COVID-19, pregnant women, infants, and older adults. Persons with chronic underlying medical conditions or acute infections should postpone or reduce strenuous exercise until the advisory is lifted. Where appropriate, maintain physical distancing. Anyone experiencing symptoms such as continuing eye or throat irritation, chest discomfort, shortness of breath, cough or wheezing, should follow the advice of their health care provider. Staying indoors helps to reduce particulate matter exposure. Real-time air quality observations and information regarding the health effects of air pollution can be found at https://www2.gov.bc.ca/gov/content/environment/air-land-water/air. ### For more information on current air quality, visit www2.gov.bc.ca/gov/content/environment/air-land-water/air. Visit www.airhealth.ca for information on how to reduce your health risk and your personal contribution to pollution levels, as well as for current and forecast AQHI values. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada.
Expires: 2021-03-12T07:39:01-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, the B.C. Ministry of Environment, 2021-03-11T15:40:01-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.0596501933.2021
Area: North Okanagan
properties.Author: Environment Canada, the B.C. Ministry of Environment

properties.Title: Blizzard Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Blizzard conditions continue at Aklavik. Conditions are expected to improve later this evening. ### Travel is expected to be hazardous due to reduced visibility. Blizzard warnings are issued when widespread reduced visibilities of 400 metres or less are expected for at least 4 hours. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to NTstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #NTStorm.
Expires: 2021-03-12T07:59:57-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2021-03-11T22:37:57-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.2939687316.2021
Area: Aklavik Region
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Winter Storm Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Hazardous winter conditions are expected. Total snowfall: 20 to 30 cm by Saturday morning. Maximum wind gusts Friday: easterly up to 60 km/h . Maximum wind gusts Friday night: northerly up to 80 km/h Locations: Nain to Makkovik Time span: Beginning Friday morning and persisting into Saturday. Remarks: Snow and blowing snow will develop Friday morning and then persist through Friday night and into Saturday. Near-zero visibilities in white-out conditions are expected at times. ### Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to NLstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #NLwx.
Expires: 2021-03-12T18:59:56-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2021-03-12T03:00:56-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.0871179466.2021
Area: Postville - Makkovik, Hopedale and vicinity, Nain and vicinity
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Rainfall Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Rain, at times heavy, is expected. A stalled Pacific front over the North Coast will give rain at times heavy to North Coast - inland including Kitimat tonight through Friday. Rainfall amounts near 50 mm can be expected by Friday evening before the rain eases. ### Heavy downpours can cause flash floods and water pooling on roads. Localized flooding in low-lying areas is possible. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to BCstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #BCStorm.
Expires: 2021-03-12T15:52:27-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2021-03-11T23:53:27-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.4161900637.2021
Area: North Coast - inland including Kitimat
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Wind Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Westerly winds reaching near 90 kilometres per hour are expected beginning midday Friday. ### Loose objects may be tossed by the wind and cause injury or damage. Wind warnings are issued when there is a significant risk of damaging winds. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to QCstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #QCStorm.
Expires: 2021-03-12T12:47:24-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2021-03-11T20:48:24-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.1281258225.2021
Area: Grande-Vallée area, Sainte-Anne-des-Monts area, Anticosti
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Winter Storm Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Hazardous winter conditions are expected. Snowfall amounts of 15 to 20 cm are expected by Friday evening. The snow combined with moderate winds will cause blowing snow which will significantly reduce visibilities. ### Visibility will be suddenly reduced to near zero at times in heavy snow and blowing snow. Winter storm warnings are issued when multiple types of severe winter weather are expected to occur together. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to QCstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #QCStorm.
Expires: 2021-03-12T19:13:56-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2021-03-12T03:14:56-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.0577585344.2021
Area: LG Quatre - Laforge and Fontanges
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Special Weather Statement In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: A complex storm will affect the North Coast and Haida Gwaii tonight through Friday. A Pacific front will remain nearly stationary on a line from the North Coast to Haida Gwaii tonight through Friday. Heavy precipitation and strong winds will accompany this storm. Current model guidance suggests that Haida Gwaii and North Coast - coastal sections could receive significant snowfall Friday night. North Coast - inland including Stewart may see a prolonged period of snowfall Friday night through Saturday. South of the front, Terrace is expected to see heavy rainfall. Snowfall and rainfall amounts for this event are still being determined at the moment due to the uncertainty of the position of the front. Weather alerts may be issued at a later time as forecast confidence increases. ### Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to BCstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #BCStorm.
Expires: 2021-03-12T15:36:51-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2021-03-11T23:37:51-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.0930469477.2021
Area: Haida Gwaii, North Coast - coastal sections, North Coast - inland including Terrace, North Coast - inland including Stewart
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Special Air Quality Statement In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Elevated pollution levels are expected or occurring. DUST ADVISORY IN EFFECT FOR QUESNEL (March 10, 2021 10:00 - Kamloops) The Ministry of Environment and Climate Change Strategy in collaboration with the Northern Health Authority has issued a Dust Advisory for Quesnel because of high concentrations of coarse particulate matter that are expected to persist until there is precipitation, dust suppression or a change in traffic patterns. Levels tend to be highest around busy roads and industrial operations. This advisory is in effect until further notice. Exposure is particularly a concern for individuals with chronic conditions such as asthma, COPD, heart disease, and diabetes, respiratory infections such as COVID-19, pregnant women, infants, and older adults. Persons with chronic underlying medical conditions or acute infections should postpone or reduce strenuous exercise until the advisory is lifted. Where appropriate, maintain physical distancing. Anyone experiencing symptoms such as continuing eye or throat irritation, chest discomfort, shortness of breath, cough or wheezing, should follow the advice of their health care provider. Staying indoors helps to reduce particulate matter exposure. Real-time air quality observations and information regarding the health effects of air pollution can be found at https://www2.gov.bc.ca/gov/content/environment/air-land-water/air. ### For more information on current air quality, visit www2.gov.bc.ca/gov/content/environment/air-land-water/air. Visit www.airhealth.ca for information on how to reduce your health risk and your personal contribution to pollution levels, as well as for current and forecast AQHI values. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada.
Expires: 2021-03-12T07:39:34-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, the B.C. Ministry of Environment, 2021-03-11T15:40:34-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.0566776919.2021
Area: Cariboo - north including Quesnel
